unnormalised: Dr. Rajesh Kumar, formerly Head of Cardiology at AIIMS, New Delhi, has accepted the position of Chief Medical Officer (CMO) at Global Healthcare Ltd., effective 10/20/2024. This announcement comes after Dr. Kumar's distinguished 25-year career at AIIMS, where he pioneered several groundbreaking treatments for cardiovascular diseases, including a novel minimally invasive surgery technique for mitral valve repair.
normalised: Doctor Rajesh Kumar, formerly Head of Cardiology at A-I-I-M-S, New Delhi, has accepted the position of Chief Medical Officer (C-M-O) at Global Healthcare Limited, effective twentieth October two thousand and twenty four. This announcement comes after Doctor Kumar's distinguished twenty five year career at A-I-I-M-S, where he pioneered several groundbreaking treatments for cardiovascular diseases, including a novel minimally invasive surgery technique for mitral valve repair.

unnormalised: Global Healthcare Ltd., a rapidly expanding chain of multi-specialty hospitals across India, cited Dr. Kumar's extensive experience and leadership skills as key factors in their decision. The organization believes his expertise will be instrumental in elevating the quality of care and expanding the range of services offered at their facilities nationwide.
normalised: Global Healthcare Limited, a rapidly expanding chain of multi-specialty hospitals across India, cited Doctor Kumar's extensive experience and leadership skills as key factors in their decision. The organization believes his expertise will be instrumental in elevating the quality of care and expanding the range of services offered at their facilities nationwide.

unnormalised: "We are delighted to welcome Dr. Kumar to the Global Healthcare family," stated Mr. Sanjay Verma, CEO of Global Healthcare Ltd. in a press release issued earlier today. "His expertise in cardiology, coupled with his proven track record of innovation and patient-centric care, aligns perfectly with our mission to provide affordable and accessible healthcare to all."
normalised: "We are delighted to welcome Doctor Kumar to the Global Healthcare family," stated Mister Sanjay Verma, C-E-O of Global Healthcare Limited in a press release issued earlier today. "His expertise in cardiology, coupled with his proven track record of innovation and patient-centric care, aligns perfectly with our mission to provide affordable and accessible healthcare to all."

unnormalised: Dr. Kumar, an alumnus of Maulana Azad Medical College, holds an MBBS, MD, and DM in Cardiology. He has published over 100 peer-reviewed articles in leading medical journals and has been recognized with several prestigious awards, including the Padma Bhushan for his contributions to medicine. In a statement released through AIIMS, Dr. Kumar expressed his gratitude to the institution and its staff for their support throughout his career. He emphasized his commitment to continuing his work in advancing medical science and improving patient outcomes in his new role at Global Healthcare.
normalised: Doctor Kumar, an alumnus of Maulana Azad Medical College, holds an M-B-B-S, M-D, and D-M in Cardiology. He has published over one hundred peer-reviewed articles in leading medical journals and has been recognized with several prestigious awards, including the Padma Bhushan for his contributions to medicine. In a statement released through A-I-I-M-S, Doctor Kumar expressed his gratitude to the institution and its staff for their support throughout his career. He emphasized his commitment to continuing his work in advancing medical science and improving patient outcomes in his new role at Global Healthcare.

unnormalised: "I am excited to embark on this new chapter with Global Healthcare," Dr. Kumar stated. "I look forward to collaborating with their talented team of healthcare professionals to deliver world-class medical services to patients across the country." The transition is expected to be seamless, with Dr. Anita Desai, currently Associate Professor of Cardiology, assuming the role of Acting Head of Cardiology at AIIMS, effective immediately. Dr. Desai, who holds a PhD in Cardiovascular Physiology, is a highly respected researcher and clinician in her own right.
normalised: "I am excited to embark on this new chapter with Global Healthcare," Doctor Kumar stated. "I look forward to collaborating with their talented team of healthcare professionals to deliver world-class medical services to patients across the country." The transition is expected to be seamless, with Doctor Anita Desai, currently Associate Professor of Cardiology, assuming the role of Acting Head of Cardiology at A-I-I-M-S, effective immediately. Doctor Desai, who holds a P-h-D in Cardiovascular Physiology, is a highly respected researcher and clinician in her own right.

unnormalised: Sources familiar with the matter indicate that Dr. Kumar's decision to leave AIIMS was motivated by a desire to contribute to the private healthcare sector and implement innovative models of care delivery on a larger scale. Global Healthcare's commitment to investing in cutting-edge technology and expanding its reach to underserved communities resonated with Dr. Kumar's vision for the future of healthcare in India.
normalised: Sources familiar with the matter indicate that Doctor Kumar's decision to leave A-I-I-M-S was motivated by a desire to contribute to the private healthcare sector and implement innovative models of care delivery on a larger scale. Global Healthcare's commitment to investing in cutting-edge technology and expanding its reach to underserved communities resonated with Doctor Kumar's vision for the future of healthcare in India.

unnormalised: The announcement has been met with positive reactions from the medical community, with many expressing their admiration for Dr. Kumar's accomplishments and wishing him success in his new endeavor. His departure from AIIMS marks the end of an era but also signals a new beginning for Global Healthcare, which is poised to further solidify its position as a leading healthcare provider in India under Dr. Kumar's leadership. Furthermore, the hospital's shares jumped by 3% since the official announcement went live at 11:30 AM.
